name: The Lancaster

reviews.title: Quaint
reviews.text: Stayed for nights after a long haul from Australia. Staff extremely friendly and helpful (esp Russell on front desk). Breakfast and dinner very tasty and well prepared. Only problem being that the front desk could not provide information regarding location of a doctor, so hubby had to call 911 as I was quite ill the 2nd day. Not really a downside as the 4 young blokes who came to my rescue were terrific!

I booked The Lancaster for a quick business trip to Houston and I look forward to doing so again. The staff was excellent and the hotel provides free breakfast in their great bistro as well as free wifi. The Lancaster has the charm of a boutique hotel, far from the cliche chain hotels I usually stay at. The hotel is undergoing renovations, but I look forward to visiting again when they are complete. Great price, great service, and a great stay!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Downtown Houston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all I will start by saying this a great location for a hotel. Right in the heart of the cultural district in Downtown Houston. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends, but I would also want people to be aware of the experience we had on our stay.
reviews.title: Nice Historic Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - The hotel staff were really good. The valet attendants had our car ready in 10 minutes or less and they do tell you to contact them 15 minutes prior to leaving. The valet is 30.00 per night with unlimited in and out privileges. I thought that was a little steep but after walking around downtown all other lots are 40.00 or higher for the daily max with no in and out.
reviews.title: Lancaster, Houston, TX

reviews.text: The front desk employee, Russell, was a really nice guy. He made sure we were taken care of and did a speedy check in process. He also gave us a coupon for a free appetizer at the Aquarium restaurant. He did tell us that there was an 8.95 fee per guest for the "free" breakfast buffet that would be charged on our bill. I wasn't too happy with this charge as we did not go to the breakfast bar at all on our 3 day stay. When I asked to have the charged removed I was denied. That is the one problem I had with the service during our stay. Russell also informed us that they were in the middle of a renovation on the hotel and its rooms, but that the movers would only be working during a 10am to 5pm shift. This was false, I was woken up every morning by people moving furniture at 7:30 - 8:00 am. Normally I wouldn't care, but this was a getaway weekend and we wanted to sleep later than normal. This also caused a problem on the two elevators in the hotel. We were forced to wait 4 or 5 times on the elevator because it was full of furniture being moved from one floor to the other.
reviews.title: Long History of Great Experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lancaster was tremendous on every point. Though within 2 blocks of the Opera on the night we were going it was raining to hard to walk. The hotel shuttle came to the rescue on both taking us and picking us up. All the employees were courteous and friendly The bistro restaurant food was well above expectation and very attentive to our early Opera time. The room had not yet been remodeled but was clean and fresh. Definitely a first choice for staying in downtown Houston..
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel

reviews.text: Valet, front desk, restaurant, and other staff were nice and professional. It is $35.00 for the valet and you will need to valet park. I picked this hotel for the great location and because I found it at a decent rate. Even though this hotel is being renovated, my husband and I loved the atmosphere and the history of The Lancaster. I learned Mr. Clark Gable lived there while pursuing his career in the Houston theater. If I can afford a room after the renovation, I would definitely go back to The Lancaster.
reviews.title: We were treated well by the staff, complimentary suburban shuttle within 3 miles and nice breakfast buffet

reviews.text: As most reviews have already noted the location is ideal as it was in the main hub of Houston.However this is one of the only positives I could describe,much to my disappointment.I have stayed in numerous hotels in America for both business and pleasure and not once have I come across front desk and mangerial staff as rude and obnoxious as i did here at the Lancaster. They were short,dismissive, arrogant and some what disrespectful to younger customers. For a hotel that prides itself in customer service I find it laughable that they display such characteristics. I would urge the hotel to offer opportunities for their staff to brush up on etiquette and manners!
reviews.title: Manners don't cost a thing!

reviews.text: First business trip to Houston. I stayed here 8 nights and the hotel was excellent. The room was a nice size - not too small, not too big, and the bed - honestly - the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The room was serviced daily to a very high standard. The complimentary wi-fi service was relatively fast and reliable and the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel runs a free transporation service for trips within a three mile radius which was very useful and - for longer journeys - managed to book us taxis fairly quickly (which is unusual for Houston as anyone who's ever been there will know!).
reviews.title: Business Trip

reviews.text: The restaurant/bistro is very good with good quality food.
reviews.title: Very disappointing!

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Lancaster and enjoyed it very much. Our room was pretty and the beds remarkably comfortable. Very conventient for the Hobby PAC and Jones Hall. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Excellent Theatre District Hotel

reviews.text: We had a wonderful family stay at the Lancaster. I wanted something with character and older. The Lancaster provided a great historical feel with modern amenities. Great location for our concert at the theater that was one block over, as well as walking distance for a variety of family dining. My husband and I also enjoyed great hospitality from bartender and beverage manager in the evening.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Spent two nights at the Lancaster. My room was nice enough (no fridge/mini bar) but the furniture is somewhat older and marred. One black-out blind facing the well-lit city street was inoperable. Upon arrival my bathroom sink was caked with some unknown soot or dirt (perhaps expelled from the faucet?) Also found it in the bathtub. Consequently the lavatory faucet barely dribbled water when turned on. I tried removing the filtration screen to no avail. Maid service on the second day had not arrived by 4PM. The downstairs restaurant is minuscule and packed to the gills during meals and happy hour. Two elevators only; slow service during busy times of day. Only valet parking - $30 a day. Across street from Alley Theatre and Jones Hall.
reviews.title: Good, older downtown hotel. In process of sprucing up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel because it was just across the street from the concert hall. It came up to standard on all points, but the room was rather small and the dining area rather cramped. Staff were helpful, and the valet parking worked out fine.
reviews.title: Ideal for the Jones Hall
Last minute stay was great
reviews.text: I had an overnight layover in Houston and decided to go check out the downtown area. Unfortunately/fortunately it was NBA All-Star weekend and the first hotel I checked was booked solid. They called over to the Lancaster and they had one room available. By the time I got to the hotel it was getting quite late and after talking with an extremely nice manager I was given a discounted price for my room. She even insisted on giving me a free beer to enjoy! The other staff were also quite personable. The hotel was quite classy and I like the fact it is independently owned rather than part of some giant chain. Highly recommended if you're in the Houston area.

There are certain hotels that remind you of the classics - the Waldorf Astoria in New York, the Palmer House in Chicago. Those are large institutions that somehow retain a classic feel. The Lancaster is a small hotel that feels the same, but in a sense even better because of the cozy, old (but not run down) feel. Don't expect over-the-top luxury, but instead everything is "just right." The room was small but perfectly adequate and everything worked fine. The dinner service was excellent, if a bit pricey and a hot buffet is included in the room price (as is internet - are you listening large hotel chains?). Apparently, The Lancaster is about to begin a renovation project which will only make this establishment better.
reviews.title: A Throwback - In a Very Nice Way

reviews.text: We have enjoyed staying at this hotel several times. The restaurant is good, the rooms are nice and bedding excellant.
reviews.title: Best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the location as directly in the theater district, they have some shuttle service within 5 mi. Good restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very impressive building and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $30. charge for parking but now the breakfast is included.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Lancaster!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at The Lancaster, it is a bit expensive, but you certainly get the service. Breakfast was included and was very good, with hot and cold options. The staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Charming historical hotel

description: Recently accepted into the Historic Hotels of America with Stately elegance and Outstanding service in a Historic Downtown location with Luxurious accommodations. These are the hallmarks of The Lancaster hotel. Here at The Lancaster Hotel in Downtown Houston, Texas, classic luxury and a grand tradition of hospitality blend perfectly with modern technology and warm, personalized service. Our stylish boutique hotel combines classic modern design, pampering services, amenities and superior comfort to exceed the expectations of the discriminating business or leisure traveler. The Lancaster is perfectly situated in Houston’s theater district near all the entertainment in downtown Houston, including Houston’s finest culinary, cultural and entertainment destinations. Experience luxurious comfort in our 93 tastefully appointed guest rooms and suites designed with the amenities and ambiance you have come to expect from a luxury boutique hotel. Unwind in the plush comfort of down duvets and feather pillows, Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries, plush bathrobes; complimentary wireless high-speed Internet, complimentary courtesy car service to nearby attractions and businesses and much more. Relax with the knowledge that we are completely at your service.
